intro: Lomelosia minoana subsp. asterusica, commonly known as the Minoan lomelosia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Crete. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in the arid and sunny conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
